Summary I hold a PhD in Computer Science, and MS and BS in Computer Engineering.  
 
My background includes Data Mining/Web Mining, Multimedia and Information Retrieval, User Modeling, Recommendation Systems and Online Computational Advertising.  
 
I have vastly worked with large data collections such as Flickr, Yahoo News, Yahoo Query and Web logs, and as well on Twitter data. I have also done various researches on credit card user's transactions, Sentiment Analysis with Yahoo and Yelp data, and geographic localization of images and videos. 
 
My specialities are Apache Hadoop/PIG, Java, Python and R.

Honors & Awards Qkly - Avoid Boring Queues Winner of the First Edition Innova Challenge Big Data by BBVA Bank December 2013 WHAT IS IT? 
How many times did you get stuck in the queue at a supermarket or at a grocery store? How do you feel to go shopping during the sales period? And when you're visiting some attractions or museums? Have you ever wondered if there is a way in which you could have avoided it? 
 
Qkly automatically produces optimized schedules of all the business, attractions, or places based on your preferences. Using historical data provided by the BBVA Open API, Qkly is able to estimate how crowded a place is at a certain time. Based on this information, it helps you to pick the time in which less people are present, so as to save time and avoid stress. 
 
Website: 
http://grupoweb.upf.edu/innova/q_kly/ 
 
Google Play App: 
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.q_kly 
 
Award: 
https://www.centrodeinnovacionbbva.com/en/pages/29293-winners Quartz 2nd Winner of the First Edition Innova Challenge Big Data by BBVA Bank December 2013 THE INTERFACE 
Quartz allows you to explore how people spend their money. The pie charts on the map represent the amount of money spent by people at a particular location, split by customer gender or business category. 
 
THE FILTERING 
The legend on the bottom right corner allows you to filter out genders or categories you are not interested in. 
 
THE QUARTZ WHEEL 
If you want more information, you can click on a pie chart to open the Quartz Wheel. If you move the mouse on a segment of the wheel, you can see the number of payments in the center. Also, you can see additional segments on the wheel representing how the payments in the category distribute in sub-segments. If you move from a segment to one of its sub-segment, you will see the percentage of payments in the segment which refer to it, as well as the percentage on the total amount for the location. 
 
Website: 
http://grupoweb.upf.edu/innova/quartz3d/ 
 
Award: 
https://www.centrodeinnovacionbbva.com/en/pages/29293-winnersless Best Paper Runner-up ICMR2013 April 2013 Michele Trevisiol, Guillaume Gravier, Jonathan Delhumeau, Hervé Jégou,  
“Retrieving geo-location of videos with a divide & conquer hierarchical multimodal approach”,  
April 16 – 19, Dallas, Texas (USA), 2013, [Best Paper Runner-up]

Summary History: 
 
Nathan created several applications while working for various companies. These companies include University of Maryland, Department of State, Criterion Systems, CACI, AboutWeb.com, Delaware.net, American Airlines, GTE/Verizon, Oreck, and Cameron Ashley Building Products.Working both solo and as part of a team, Nathan has developed a variety of applications, including a: Y2K project American Airlines, customer service management tool kit, planning system, budget forecasting system, purchase order system, inventory system, stats system, project management system, calendar, message board, and an asset management system .  
 
He and his lovely wife of 29 years, Stacey, love and adore their three handsome boys, Nathan (26), Anthony (20) and Christopher (11). Stacey has a hobby of decorating cakes and Nathan enjoys the time they spend together. The Wii, Xbox 360, and PC games are popular diversions for Nathan and his sons. He likes to go fishing with his boys when not spending time with his wife. They reside in Harrington, Delaware. Yes, I know what a long trip to get to work.

* Search Engine Optimization (SEO) and marketing 
* CRM system design and implementation 
* Oracle, PSQL, MS SQL, T-SQL, MySQL, Sybase 
* MS Project, Crystal Reports, Visual SourceSafe, TopStyle Pro, Adobe suite 
* Flex, Flash, Spry, Ajax, Apollo, Web Services  
* Visual Studio, ColdFusion Studio, Dreamweaver  
* FuseBox, Mach-II, Model-Glue, ColdBox

Playing with my kids, Church, Computers, Programming Research, Football, Grilling, Computer Gaming, Wii, and Xbox 360. Summary I have worked in the IT Industry since 1977 and with IBM Midrange systems since 1980.  
 
I currently work for Draper Tools, supporting their bespoke AS400 in-house systems. I am also working on a complete redesign of the corporate web site to incorporate additional functionality, including mobile devices and social media. 
 
In the past I have worked in both permanent and contract positions and I have worked in a number of countries, with multi-company and multi-currency systems and a variety of business types. 
 
I returned to the UK at the end of July 2009 after 15 years in the USA. I have dual UK/USA citizenship, so working in either country is not a problem. However I am happy in my current job I have no plans to change employment or to relocate at this time, so please don't send me any job offers.  
 
As well as working in IT, I enjoy travel and photography. I enjoy creating my own web sites and blogs and have been publishing articles on various sites for the last 10 years. I am also currently researching information so I can begin work on my first book, a historical novel based on the early life of my grandfather.
